sentence.text: I 'm certain that he did n't set out to mislead .
` I 'm sure you understand that I must feel absolutely certain that you would n't share our secret -- with anyone , " he explained to her .
Others have thought the figure an akroterion , and one can be fairly certain that the idea of making a free-standing statue in motion was first developed in that architectural context .
` I 'm certain he will play for England again and put that first experience behind him . "
She was certain his faith would be infectious ; that , like maternal love being born fiercely with the baby , her belief would spring to life with marriage .
He was equally certain they could cross the barrier between gorgio and Romany together .
He laughed , then frowned at the aircraft 's controls as if he was not entirely certain what most of them did .
He was n't certain why the expression made his stomach churn , but churn it did .
No one , for example , was quite certain how diseases were disseminated .
All the same , it is important that the trainee should have as broad a base as possible , particularly if he is not certain which field is likely to offer the best opening .
This means you can be quite certain about total success , relative success and failure and , therefore , be in a better position to learn from experience .
As Hunt saw the situation on that first Sunday in a new team , he could not be certain about his own capabilities .
The French , having been victims of German occupation , were much less certain about this policy .
And since they 've refused repeatedly to have a public inquiry into what is going on there we 're not certain of the safety of what 's coming out .
This proved to be far in excess of the minimum required for immunity , and although the researchers can not be certain of directly comparable results in man , the prospects seem reasonably good .
The funerary archaeologist has to be certain of the differences between desiccation and chemical preservation : embalming .
It 's going on raining all night , I 'm certain of that , but we can feed underground here , you know .
She thought that it was odd that she should be so certain of Beuno 's allegiance with her against one of his countrymen , but she had no doubts of him .
Moreover , the weight of authority on the construction of those two subsections will enable both the landlord and the tenant to be more certain of the legal scope of the power .
` Dr Runcie , to his eternal credit , remained his friend , though he had read the preface some weeks before and was certain in his own mind of its authorship .
You must , therefore , be certain , I repeat , certain beyond reasonable doubt that Paul Menzies could have committed such an evil crime as murder .
Live and let live I say , but unless I want to be certain of constantly bumping into parties of rambling Rotarians , I think I will keep off these organised highways .
Hitler had no wish to provoke an armed conflict that he was not certain of winning .
It 's important though to remember that the value of the investment itself will fluctuate so you can not be certain of getting capital back intact .
Even a prince whose parentage was known could not be certain of succeeding his father , especially if his mother had been discarded from the royal bed .
He had become certain by watching the preparations in the sepoy camp that they would make a major assault within the next few hours .
They feel less certain about how the outside world will look upon attainments and assessments once the whole post-1988 process is open to public question .
The world well knows how this conflict began … and I am certain of how it will end …
It is interesting to note that management and professional staff are the least certain as to whether they will move with their jobs .

A year later , when Lorne and I reached Celebes to make our first film , the star-gazing Toraja priests were no more certain as to when , or even if , this climactic coup-de-grace to their culture would occur .
They may however have achieved a realization of theoretical proposals : but we can not be certain about that until further research has been undertaken into the workings of the Household .
The bullets may bounce off the sides of the slits or go plumb through the middle , so that we can not be certain of exactly where they will hit the second screen .
She was reasonably certain by then that it was merely a necessary preliminary to the real business he had with her .
“ How can you be so certain ? ”
` I ca n't tell you how I know , but I 'm certain .
They are certain there must be a number of people who could benefit .
